item.title: evading the wifi router ban
item.description: Wifi router ban I currently live in student family housing at the University of California, Berkeley. Several years ago, Berkeley IT announced a new policy for wifi routers: Effective July 1, 2024, use of personal routers will no longer be permitted at UVA [student family housing], as is the case in all other campus housing. Residents who continue to use a personal router after this date may be notified to shut off the wireless broadcast or risk having the router blocked from usage on the campus network.

item.title: Yes, you too, reader, should believe you may be world-class – Daniel Frank
item.description: [Something I’ve struggled with in my adult life is truly internalizing that I’m exceptionally great at certain niche things and acting on this belief—not just best in my fifth-grade class great, or best in my summer camp great, but actually one of the best in a specific category of traits/skills/interests. This post is mostly written as a self-affirmation, but I think it is useful for many others as well, looking for a little more encouragement that they too are world-class.]
